Author: Kellie Lutze
Review:
A beautiful park with busy touristy areas and a quiet places for all people. A good range of trees, water features and walkways make this a good use of green space that can be used to get out of the hustle and bustle and relax by yourself, with friends or someone special.

Temples can also be found in this park for additional cultural value.

Author: M Leong
Review:
Great, relaxing temple to walk around.

Quite a climb to get to the top, but there's a slope on the slide that makes the journey easier.

Once you're up, you're rewarded with quiet views of various temples.

Author: Yi Jing Choy
Review: Went three times, rainy, sunny and at night. The atmosphere is different at all times of the day so do pop by a few times if you have time to spare. There are food stalls lined at the side for a quick meal, and it connects to Yasaka shrine. Pretty crowded most of the time, especially during the Hanami season.

Author: Zachary Oliver
Review: Beautiful park to stroll through to or from all the temples on the east side of Kyoto in late April.  Events are held here. Nice pond and FREE. Leads to several shrines but they close around 5

Author: Justin Lim
Review: It's beautiful. There's even a guy playing the flute with his dog. It's like the park has its own soundtrack. Dog has its own sword. Don't mess with dog.

Author: alyssa dueck
Review: Beautiful shrine area. A lot of (overpriced) food vendors and several tourists but the shrine itself was lovely and well worth the visit as entry was free and the grounds were very impressive. Would highly recommend!

Author: Hadi Forghani
Review:
In spring it is totally like a dream
At night you can have dinner under cherry blossoms (sakura) which is a very memorrable
Try to go sooner to find a nice place
There are small shops there with delicious foods and drinks

Author: Felix Krause
Review: Incredibly nice park during spring blossom season. The park is filled with Sakura trees and have a nice market, some shrines and a area where you can sit under the cherry trees and eat and drink. Extremely cozy in the evening. Also has one of the biggest cherry trees I have ever seen.

Author: Emma Keppler
Review: Shrine and park, is a great places to sit with friends and family for cherry blossom season. Good food stand and nice trails to walk.

Author: Ashutosh Singh
Review:
Maruyama park is famous for cherry blossoms
. One must come in that time.. unfortunately I didn't able to come on that time...
It is has lot of cherry blossoms tree and great view...
Walkable distance from kiyomizu dera..

Author: Valdas
Review: Unfortunately I visited this park while it was raining and also while there was a lot of construction and maintenance work being done on the various temples in the park which effected my opinion of the place somewhat. The park is generally well maintained and clean and the various ponds, trees and most importantly temples are great to see. I am told this park is most beautiful during the cherry blossom season but it's a shame you cant experience that outside the specific blooming season. Unfortunately this park has clearly become a major tourist attraction as there are various snack, drink and souvenir shops scattered around the park in addition to vending machines and many tourists visit this place as it even has its own dedicated tour bus parking. This has somewhat over commercialised the park which has resulted in it losing some of its charm and despite having many temples and shrines it's not quite a tranquil experience. While this is not one of the best parks I've been to in Japan I still think if you are in the area the park and temples are worth a visit. Also, FYI the park has a number of public restrooms without an enterence fee, and also keep in mind photography is not allowed at the enterence of many of the shrines in this park.

Author: KahFui Lim
Review:
Great park to feed the pigeon and a short break after a long walking in the morning.

It‚Äôs a walk in a little park, with great view of lake from the bridge.

Little boy is being excited and chasing the pigeons away.

Author: Cassie Schornack
Review: Very beautiful park to get to explore. We met some very friendly people who pointed out some of the turtles that were sunbathing and told us about some of the more interesting points of interest. I'm not sure what it was called but the lantern lined building was very beautiful and interesting to look at one of my favorite places we visited that day.

Author: Jack Liu
Review: I went during winter, so the autumn leaves were all but gone. However, this is a very good place to see them when in season. There are food stalls if you're hungry, and you can proceed to the main park area for some very nice photos. This is a small walk from the main Gion shopping street, so definitely give this place a visit.

Author: Rizki Purwani
Review: When I visited Yasaka Shrine in Kyoto, I found this beautiful park "Maruyama Park". I really enjoyed the view in this park, I could the the leaves got red and yellow as it's autumn :)

Author: Hyejee Kim
Review: It is one of the best place to visit during spring. Beautiful cherry blossom trees are everywhere. There are also many places to sit down and relax. You can get beer and food from street restarants. A lot to see and good place to spend time with friends and family. A lot of photo spots too.

Author: Burger Burger
Review: Definitely a must go during good weather. Cherry blossom season is lovely. As of 30/3/19, not full bloom just some trees blooming so must go... take a walk from Yasaka to here then to kodaiji shrine ... v nice...

Author: Miki Matsubara
Review:
I visited here on 16 Mar 2019, during the spring event called ‚ÄòHigashiyama Hanatouro‚Äô
Many flower arrangements display here and there, big figures made by college students.
After sunset, roads were lit with lantern and a couple of events were held.

Author: Amanda Lee
Review: If you want to eat, drink, and hang out while looking at cherry blossoms, this is the best place to do it! There were a ton of food vendors throughout the park (some sell alcohol too), but many groups were bringing their own food/drinks to have picnics on the tatami mats that were all around. There was even a fun haunted house!

Author: Sue Choi
Review: Went for hanami in Spring. Absolutely beautiful. Many tourists and locals alike enjoying night time picnic on reserved tables and tatami matted grounds (provided by park for free)

Author: Noppharat Intha
Review: Great! This place is good for you weekend or vacation on spring season especially in cherry blossom times.

Author: Reindz
Review: One of the best sakura bloom in kyoto, there are plenty of sakura trees here. Good ambience to have some beers and grilled food here. But if you want to sit at the tables area you have to order from the respective restaurants there. If you are buying street food from the stalls, you can only find those sitting bench in the park or to bring a picnic mat to sit on the ground.

Author: Kinzang Wangchuk
Review:
This is my second best Cherry blossom viewing spot in Kyoto after the Philosopher‚Äôs path. For all Sakura lovers, this is one of the spots we should never miss. It is a wonderful park filled with various species of Cherry blossom trees covering the whole park. I was lucky to be there during the peak of the blooming season where the whole area is brightened with fabulous white and pink flowers. I am very delighted to visit here, and I enjoyed the atmosphere so much.
There are plenty of food and drink stalls where we can buy snacks and drinks, grab a mat and start picnic under the blooming sakura trees. We can burrow mats for free of cost and it is great compliments for the travelers.
Awesome spot for Sakura and a fantastic place for a picnic especially during Hanami Festival.

Author: CAI GAN XIAN Lucas
Review: Beautiful park currently under construction. Cannot wait to see the end. A small river will be added to the park.

Author: The Journey
Review: Maruyama Park (ÂÜÜÂ±±ÂÖ¨Âúí, Maruyama K≈çen) is a public park next to Yasaka Shrine in the Higashiyama District. In the first half of April, when the cherry trees are in full bloom, the park becomes Kyoto's most popular and most crowded spot for cherry blossom viewing parties (hanami). The centerpiece of the park is a tall shidarezakura (weeping cherry tree), which gets lit up in the night.(Japan Guide)

Author: David P
Review: This is a beautiful park filled with trees, streams, ponds, covered seating areas... So tranquil and peaceful. After a long day of working checking out temples and shrines, this is a lovely place to hang out for a while to recharge. even though we do not come here during cherry blossom season, it was so a very memorable area to walk through.

Author: Smita Vyas Kumar
Review: I didn't explore this park much as I went there only to take photos of myself in a kimono. But the parts I saw were pretty.

Author: Danny Reyes
Review: Beautiful park and gardens with cherry blossoms scattered throughout. Very peaceful during the April blossom. There are also various shrines located throughout the park. There is an area to eat outdoors along with a few street food vendors. They are currently renovating a stream that will ride along the gardens. You can easily spend a few hours strolling the gardens and admiring the serene surroundings.

Author: Kate Stevenson
Review: Within walking distance from our airbnb this was a wonderful park/garden. Saw my first Geisha and the gardens are beautiful. Highly recommended a visit.

Author: Alvin Leow
Review: Maruyama Park is the perfect place to escape from the crowd as this place is less frequented by tourists. Drop by for some fresh air and to soak in the zen surroundings with beautiful gardens and lakes.

Author: Neil - The Backpack Adventures
Review: Maruyama Park is an awesome park to visit as it's free and has plenty of space. Visit during spring to see the flowers particularly the weeping cherry try. VIsit in Autumn and see the trees "burn" in a yellow and orange foliage. I visited Maruyama Park with my family last December 2019 and I'd say that it was an awesome time. You should come visit or add this park to your itinerary as well.

Author: gradhito
Review: Maruyama Park offers an absolute serene ambiance where you could take a quick, or heck a long, break while strolling around Gion and Higashiyama countless temples and shrines. You could say the park is located right in the middle of all the historical places, very convenient.

Author: Latifa DNI
Review:
Super conveniet to spent the golden hours with family here!

Placed in the back of Yasaka Shrine in Gion‚Äôs area, this place is really a gem in the crowded area.

I went there to feed pigeons and fish, there are also turtle and stray cats!

If you‚Äôre a pokemon go player, near the pond there‚Äôs a beautiful pokelid!

Author: Shingo Sae-Lim
Review:
(Trip was made back then on 1 Dec 2019, 2 years before the Covid-19 Pandemic hit)

Maruyama Park is Kyoto‚Äôs most popular spot for cherry blossom viewing during spring time. But they said that it also offers a beautiful view of the trees changing colours in autumn.

However, by the time we arrived in Kyoto on 1 Dec 2019, either most of the trees have shed their autumn leaves (it was the last few days of autumn season), or majority of the tree species were not predominantly not intended for autumn foliage.

So it was rather unfortunate that the view wasn‚Äôt as impressive as some of the other places we‚Äôve seen on the trip.

Nevertheless, I‚Äôm sure the park would look spectacular when the cherry blossoms bloom in spring as majority of the trees in the park are cherry blossom trees.

Still a beautiful park to take a stroll in autumn and it‚Äôs just next to Chionin and Shorenin Temple which are worth exploring.

Author: Ish J
Review: It's a nice park.Its nice to walk early in the morning because it is less crowded.Nearby you see sakamoto ryoma museum and a shrine too.

Author: Kartika Puspita Sari
Review: Located behind the Yasaka Jinja. It is one of the best places to see Sakura in Kyoto.

Author: Owasiul Islam
Review: Good place to be with kids. Best would be during Sakura.

Author: Nikki Cook
Review:
Free public park at the back of Yasaka shrine. Well worth a look after your visit to the shrine.

It was Lovely to walk around the gardens and ponds. The was seating, some of which was under covered which was welcomed when the rain began. It was quiet when I visited but I think the rain played part to that as many others say it‚Äôs busy!

Author: „Ç∏„Ç®„Éº„É†„Çπ
Review: Large walking park behind Yasaka Jinja. There is a famous, old, huge cherry tree that blooms in April. It‚Äôs a great place to stroll at any time of the  year.

Author: Amethyst Lau
Review: This is a very beautiful and organized park. It provides seats and shelter for tourists to take a break after long walk nearby. Restrooms and vending machines are also available here.

Author: Div
Review:
It‚Äôs really nice park with many Sakura trees.
They have restaurant too in it.

Author: Jawad Haqbeen
Review:
It is a beautiful public park located at center of Kyoto city.
Pros: open 24 hours

Author: Glos
Review: Super beautiful park

Author: Sendi Widjaja
Review: Big park with beautiful pond in the middle.

Author: Abbie Girl
Review: Kyoto‚Äôs version of Central Park, one could say. It‚Äôs centrally located to the Chion-in, Shoren-in, Nene-no-michi, and Ninenzaka and Sannenzaka, on the way to Kiyomizudera. The park itself has several gardens featuring wisteria and cherry blossoms. The giant cherry blossom tree is one of the more famous sights to see in Kyoto during spring - it‚Äôs lit up and worth seeing at night. There are also several cafes around the park, making it easy to spend a good part of the day here. Worth visiting if you‚Äôre in the area, and need a break from temples and shrines for a bit.

Author: Freeze Kiwii
Review: Not so bad lotvof ppl enjoyed during holidays

Author: ËóçÂÅâ‰ªª
Review: Although the cherry blossoms in the park in winter are not in bloom, they are beautiful after snowing. Remember to wear extra clothes to keep warm.

Author: Iza Rudnicka
Review: Beautiful park, I have seen the most unique blue bird next to the pond. I would go there every day if I lived in Kyoto!

Author: Kiwi
Review: Great relaxing place, when visiting you should go on the very top of the parc !

Author: Echhoumi Hamdi
Review: I loved this place.. Piece of heaven

Author: Den Nis
Review:
Enjoyed my peaceful walk there by myself. It's wide that you can enjoy the moment by yourself despite the crowd that visits the place.

Also there's a Pokemon-themed manhole cover here. It's so cute and I was glad to have found it.

Author: A L
Review: Came in the morning 9am, the place is quieter because the shops are not open until 10am. Lovely walk to the bamboo garden

Author: Wan Noriza Wan Ahmad
Review: Beautiful park. Will be nice during cherry blossoms and autumn! Lots of people during the weekend..

Author: Catherine Luker
Review: So pretty - especially with the cherry blossom out. Was lovely seeing everyone there taking photos etc.

Author: Adrien D
Review: I spent two hours in this park, it‚Äôs so nice to walk and enjoy the calm atmosphere.

Author: June Nysted
Review: Beautiful, but overcrowded. Would not go during high-season. They could have  more places to sit and enjoy the place.

Author: Kiran Kaur
Review: Beautiful Japanese park! There is many attraction area in this vicinity

Author: Seth Trompeta
Review: pretty sakuras! experienced my first spring ever, and this park definitely didn't disappoint. definitely worth the visit; however, there may be a lot of people, especially during full bloom of the sakuras

Author: Naty Schaller
Review: Very calming and a beautiful atmosphere especiall at dawn

Author: Donna Beyer
Review: The best at Sakura! The spring cherry blossoms are lovely and abundant here. They also have some water features and lights for the trees after sunset.

Author: Eric TW
Review: Beautiful during sakura season, lots of food and drink stalls and buzzing with people. I would recommend during the week if you can.

Author: Lukas Bauer
Review: Might be a little crowded, but very beautiful park!

Author: Biagio De Simone
Review: Such a magic experience to have a look at the cherry blossoms during the evening. Street food is amazing, too! Best period of the year to visit this park.

Author: Sophie Solioz
Review: Beautiful place all year long, but especially during the cherry blossoms!

Author: Catharine Trustram Eve
Review: Great streetfood, edgy, trendy.   Further up the hill is also lovely. Beautiful uplit weeping cherry tree. Lots of young people out having fun, but not rowdy.

Author: Sylvia Diamant
Review: Beautiful park to view cherry blossoms üå∏. The weeping cherry tree is out of this world!!  Highly recommend Sewaritei for cherry blossom viewing as well. You won‚Äôt be disappointed as it is THE BEST place to see cherry blossoms in Kyoto. I did a review is Sewaritei as well.

Author: Th√°i S∆°n Ng√¥
Review:
One of a great spot to enjoy sakura in Kyoto. You can enjoy in many ways such as eating and drinking while enjoying the scene or walking in the wind full of petals, etc..
In conclusion, I highly recommend this place for enjoying sakura.

Author: suzanne nawab
Review: Beautiful place to see Cherry Blossom in the months of March and April. We love spending time here by relaxing, taking photos, and eating ... Must visit this place during Cherry Blossom time , and you will fall in love with Maruyama Park..

Author: Aiman Amri
Review: Open 24 hours and free to public. Took bus here until Gion and enter through Yasaka Shrine. Lot of food stalls around the park. It is crowded during spring season but the sakura/ cherry blossom here are beautiful.

Author: Carla McNaughton
Review: A beautiful place to sit during sunset and watch the Sakura trees be illuminated. Great street food market as well.

Author: Marcel Meschenmoser
Review: Crouwded but beautiful place.

Author: Alex Oliveira
Review: In comparison to other parks, if Shinjuku‚Äôs is 5-star, this is a regular one (2-stars = not-bad), small, crowded, and the vegetation wasn‚Äôt too beautiful. We strolled around it and had a bit of fun seeing people but the park itself isn‚Äôt beautiful. I found the surrounding streets more appealing and beautiful.

Author: s v
Review: Beautiful park especially during the cherry blossom season. Several food stands were set up which made for a lively experience

Author: Terence Lee
Review: So many people. During the cherry blossom season, there‚Äôs this nice huge weeping tree in the middle of the park that looks amazing

Author: henrosaurus
Review:
April 2023 - We were not allowed to picknick here.
Staff in vests told us to leave, although everywhere around us people were doing hanami and clearly staying. Very crowded (sakura), the horror house was a lot of fun.

Author: Junes Tran
Review:
Maruyama Park is noted as the main center for cherry blossom viewing in Kyoto, and can get extremely crowded at that time of year. The park's star attraction is a weeping cherry tree which becomes lit up at night.
We visited the park at night and the next early morning. There are food shops open from lunch time to midnight. We tried the ayu grilled fish (800yen), otopus (800yen) and other popular Japanese traditional street foods.

Author: Judith Moore
Review: Very beautiful cherry blossom still on the tree but are starting to fall

Author: Victoria
Review: Lots of birds to observe by the water. Wisterias are currently in bloom.

Author: Carina Bailon
Review:
Went here last March 2023 in time for the full bloom of the cherry blossoms! It may be crowded which is great because the vibe is very festive! There were a lot of food kiosks around the park selling wagyu, takoyaki, yakitori, and ice cream!

We had lunch under cherry blossom trees. Food is a little expensive in this area. I think we spend ¬•4000 for alcohol, gyoza, edamame, and karaage for 2 people. You are mostly paying for the experience.

If you want a cheaper alternative, you may bring your mat and lay it on the ground under the cherry blossom trees and buy food around the park. Many are doing this just make sure you don‚Äôt take so much space so other people can also enjoy the view!

Author: Piyush Rathi
Review: During cherry blossom month (March-April), this park has a lot of food eateries and an open ground where a lot of people eat. For vegetarians there are a bunch of options including an Indian joint run by Tabla restaurant.

Author: S T
Review: Park is full of blooming sakura üå∏ too beautiful.

Author: Stephen Griffin
Review: A beautiful park with a stream running through it, ponds, and bridges. Even during cherry blossom season, it was not that crowded, with most people visiting the shrine or the vendor stalls lining the paths in the front. In fact, the number of people was low enough for us to see a few cranes and a cat come by to rest. There's a pokemon manhole cover here, too.

Author: Jessica Mitchell
Review: There was a festival there during my visit, had lots of fun since it was cherry blossom season. Food was great too.

Author: Daniel Rosseljong
Review: Wonderful park near many Shines.  Worth the visit for a beautiful and serene walk - especially during cherry blossoms

Author: Andrew Storey
Review: One of my favourite parks. I love the lanterns there and how the glow at night.

Author: Razvan
Review: Beautiful park

Author: Alyssa Becker
Review: A beautiful park - especially in cherry blossom season.  We didn't visit the first time in Kyoto - which is a real shame, given how close it is to Yasaka Shrine.  There were so many food stalls to enjoy and of course the cherry blossoms stole the show.

Author: Madi
Review: This is a very popular cherry blossom viewing location with many good vendors during hanami! It's conveniently located behind Yasaka Jinja and is quite a lovely place to walk nearly year round.

Author: super power vlog
Review: i love the sakura i love the places here in kyoto

Author: EC Loh
Review: Sakura session in full bloom made the visit memorable.. the varied colors of the park was amazing!

Author: Naomi Bitton
Review: wow. i feel like i was in a simulation with how beautiful it is. it is a small but perfect zen garden. i went around sunset and the view was perfect

Author: Laurie Olphin
Review: Nice place to visit, but lots of kids were there when we were. Think something was going on. Nice place to chill during seeing some temples.

Author: Vgs photos
Review: Beautiful park with many great photo opprotunities. So peaceful and serene. Not as many people here during winter and felt that we had the park to ourselves!!

Author: Julia Martins
Review: A nice place to visit if you are in the gion area. A lot of people come to take their geisha pictures but you still can find nice peaceful places. Also there's some food stalls inside if you want to try giant crab ü¶Ä

Author: Patrick Ong
Review: The park is linked to several shrines and causes it to be very commercialised. Personally I like parks that provide space for everybody and has panoramic views. However, Maruyama Park doesn‚Äôt have the luxury of wide open space. The entrance is packed with street food stalls lined up by both sides and when you enter, more of such stalls are around which totally destroy the serenity that parks suppose to have. Can definitely give it a miss.

Author: Itay Garin
Review: A really quiet and peaceful spot. Loved the koi pond

Author: Cansu EREN
Review: It is an excellent place for a walk. Besides, you can enjoy the stunning view of the forest.

Author: Coby Simon
Review: Went here with overcast weather. I‚Äôm so happy it wasn‚Äôt raining too hard and was quite quiet. Took photos with a friend and there was many different places within the park that had a different background. The nature was well kept and the temple is maintained. A couple of shops that offer sweets.

Author: Nastia Vais
Review:
Great park with temple.
We went on a rainy day so it wasn't crowded (cherry blossom season).

Author: NoahJon Marshall
Review: try to find the soft shell turtle in the pond to the right
